name: Herb-Grilled Sirloin with Tomato-Cucumber-Feta Salad and Grilled Baguette
description: Fast braai-seared sirloin with a bright Greek-style salad and crunchy grilled bread. Mild, family-friendly flavors done in under 30 minutes.
prep_steps: Preheat OutdoorGrill to high heat; clean and oil the grates.
Pat dry sirloin steak with paper towel.
Halve the lemon and set one half for squeezing; cut the other half into wedges for serving.
Dice tomatoes, chop cucumber, thinly slice red onion, and pit/slice olives if needed.
Slice baguette on the bias into 8–12 slices.
Peel the garlic clove and lightly crush.
In a bowl, combine tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and olives.
cook_steps: Season steak: rub with 1 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp oregano, 1 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper.
Dress the salad: add 2 tbsp olive oil, a big squeeze of lemon, 1/4 tsp salt, and a pinch of black pepper; toss. Top with crumbled feta and set aside.
Brush baguette slices lightly with 1 tbsp olive oil.
Grill steak over direct high heat for 3–5 minutes per side (to desired doneness). Transfer to a board and rest 5 minutes.
Grill baguette 30–60 seconds per side until lightly charred; while warm, rub one side of each slice with the crushed garlic.
Slice the rested steak across the grain.
Serve sliced steak with the tomato-cucumber-feta salad, grilled baguette, and lemon wedges.

ingredients.preparation: divided for steak, salad, and bread

final_ingredients.preparation: divided for steak, salad, and bread
